title: What's a good rock song to listen to that will get me pumped up in the morning? - Quora

response.answer_text: I often find Rock music in general a brilliant style to listen to in the morning, simply because it tends to be quite a harsh and vibe pumping genre. In terms of some great morning rockers, here is a lost of someone brilliant options to stick your ear into; “More Than A Feeling” — Boston “Free Bird” — Lynyrd Skynyrd “American Idiot” — Green Day “Morning Glory” — Oasis “Real Gone” — Sheryl Crow “Money (That's What I Want) — Barrett Strong “Little Lies” — Fleetwood Mac “Break Stuff” — Limp Bizkit “Headstrong” — Trapt “One Step Closer” — Linkin Park “Left Hand Free” — Alt J “My Way” — Limp Bizkit “Do Anything You Wanna Do” — Eddie & The Hotrods “Route 66” — Chuck Berry “Smells Like Teen Spirit” — Nirvana “(Don't Fear) The Reaper” — Blue Oyster Cult “Faith” — Limp Bizkit “Day Tripper” — The Beatles “Jailhouse Rock” — Elvis Presley “Lying From You” — Linkin Park “The Chain” — Fleetwood Mac “Fortunate Son” — Creedance Clearwater Revival “All Along The Watchtower” — Jimi Hendrix “Sweet Child ‘O Mine” — Guns ’N Roses “Highway To Hell” — AC/DC “Come Together” — The Beatles “November Rain” — Guns ’N Roses “Fly Away” — Lenny Kravitz Enjoy.

Here are a few from scattered subgenres. Show Me How To Live, Cochise, and Gasoline, all by AudioslaveLoud Love by Soundgarden (yeah, more Cornell, bear with me)Congregation, The Pretender, and Something From Nothing, all by the Foo FightersAround The World, Dark Necessities, and Dani California, all by the Red Hot Chili PeppersPretty much anything by AC/DC.Sabotage by the Beastie BoysBulls On Parade by Rage Against The MachineKings and Queens, Vox Populi, and Up In The Air, all by 30 Seconds To MarsBully, Adrenaline, and Enemies, all by ShinedownMy Name Is Human, Little One, and Wolf, all by Highly SupectLove The Way You Hate Me, and Pure Evil, both by Like A StormJump, Runnin With The Devil, and Ain't Talkin Bout Love, all by Van HalenNo One Like You, and Rock You Like A Hurricane, both by ScorpionsFoolin by Def LeppardThem Bones, Rain When I Die, Check My Brain, and Acid Bubble, all by Alice in ChainsJambi, Sober, and The Grudge, all by ToolWish You Were Here, and Nice To Know You, both by IncubusDoor to Door Cannibals, Forfeit, Joyride, and Take Out The Gunman, all by ChevelleSavior by Rise AgainstBlack Dog by Led ZeppelinBaba O' Riley by The WhoHappy music hunting.
